author: Holly Royce For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Scottish men are doing yoga in kilts and people love it | Metro News
text:
How my doctors made me doubt my invisible illness 
But nothing has quite prepared us for the bizarrely enthralling experience of watching the dudes downward dog in nought but kilts. 
The video comes from the team at BBC Social, a Facebook page showcasing fresh talent and comedy from our Scottish friends. 
Since the original posting on the 20 Feb, the clip has already been viewed over 30 million times. (Picture: BBC The Social) 
Shot and directed by filmmaker Anna Chaney, the short clip has surely sparked a tourism boost for Scotland. 
While it may still be a little chilly to attempt this kind of yoga in London right now, it’s definitely inspiring a lot of people to get off the couch and get moving. 
Gives a new meaning to the term, ‘HOT YOGA’, says one commenter. 
‘I think I’ve changed my mind about Yoga’, say another. 
Watch the video for yourself below. 
The men showing off their yogi prowess are Tristan Cameron-Harpe and Finlay Wilson, both hailing from Dundee in Scotland. 
Tristan’s Facebook page describes him as an aspiring mountaineer and model who was crowned Mr.Scotland in 2016, while Finlay is a certified Forrest Yoga teacher and a BBC content creator with an Instagram following of over 53K. A post shared by Finlay Wilson (@finlay0901) on Feb 18, 2017 at 2:27am PST 
The two are both reportedly pleased with the overwhelmingly positive response the video has received and their efforts to get people excited about yoga.
